AUDUBON LABS

Intimate space | Powerful sound

  • March 2020

  • UX Design

  • Solo Project

Creating a better system for scheduling and promotion

As business continues to grow, Audubon wanted to make it easier for artists to book a session online and promote their music.

Project Overview

About Audubon

Audubon Labs is a sound engineering and recording studio looking to expand thier artist community. Sean Jackson, the founder of Audubon, noticed that many of bookings were being coordinated by word of mouth and there would often be confusion as to when musicians were scheduled to come in. He recognized that he needed a system that would make it simple for artists to look up Audubon Labs and immidiately book a session online. Audubon also wanted the capacity to promote their aritsts by sharing music directly on their site and linking their artists' social media pages and other music sharing platforms on their site as well. This would not only encourage users to share and listen to the music they found on Audubon's site, but this feature would also serve to act as a promotion tool for Audubon's services.

User Problems

1. Audubon often had scheduling conflics and miscommunications due to a lack of a digital scheduling system

2. Audubon lacked the capacity to showcase the music they produced in-house

My Role

My role in this project was to take Sean Jackson's bussiness objectives and design a website and a mobile app that would deliver a solution to his scheduling challeneges. We also discussed the possibilities for directly sharing music on Audubon's website to promote their artists and services.


UX RESEARCHER

One of my primary responisibilities in this project was conducting thorough user research. I used a combination of user interviews, user surveys, and usability tests in order to get direct feedback from my targeted users quickly.


UX/UI DESIGNER

I created a user flow and then designed desktop and mobile layouts that mapped to that user journey I created through my research; and made sure my designs would allow users to book a session specific to their needs. I wanted my pages to be intuitive, aesthetically exciting, and simple, so that users would want to return to book another session with Audubon.

User Research

In order to conduct user research for this project I first identified the demographics of my target user and created a couple of user personas based on phone call interviews I conducted with some of Audubon's current recording artists. Based on those conversations I collected a set of data that was related to the artists' familiarity with other recodring studios in New York and what they expected to encounter when booking either a rehearsal space, recording session, or mixing session.


Throughout the research process I focused on what was required to book a recording session online and what made that process enjoyable or frustrating. Due to this being a solo project, I conducted all of the user research through google hangouts and online surveys, and then analyzed the data to create accurate user personas and design a user journey that aligned with what artists would want out of the specific pages and features.

User Personas

User Persona 1: Felix

34 / Prefessional Musician / Williamsburg

  • Studio Familiarity: High
  • Years they have been recording: 10

User Persona 2: Joan

25 / Grad Student / West Village

  • Studio Familiarity: Low
  • Years they have been recording: 0.5

User Persona 3: Matteo

40 / Accountant / Washington Heights

  • Studio Familiarity: High
  • Years they have been recording : 5

Themes and Insights

High Degree of Variability

Familiarity with studios

Through my conversations with Audubon's recording artists, I realized that Audubon's demographic differed greatly in the number of years that they have been recording, which also affected what they looked for when book a recording session at a professional studio.

High Degree of Similarity

Purpose for Recording

One of the first themes I noticed from my user research was that evry artist I spoke with wanted to record their music in order to share it with a wider audience. This made a lot of sense considering that musicians wouldn't pay the extra fee to record in a studio unless they wanted to create great sounding music in order to share it with their audience.

What Makes Booking Easy?

Put the fine print upfront

Based on my user interviews, I noticed that no matter whether the user was a seasoned recording artist or a total newby, the number one thing they look for when booking studio time is the pricing. Usually if a musician is taking the time and money to book studio time, chances are they have a budget in mind and access to comparison tools that will give them plenty of opportunity to find alternatives.

Keeping some of the important details in the first step of the booking process reminds the users of Audubon's setup and services, so they don't have to go to a new page on the site just to check if they will have everything they need. I find that this makes the scheduling process easier on the user and releives the mental burden of having to dig to find critical information.

Process

Concepting

I began my UX Design process by first consulting with the founder of Audubon, Sean Jackson, and other stakeholders to discuss goals and current challeneges he was facing in the scope of scheduling and promotion. I then spoke with Audubon's recording artists in order to gain insights about what they liked about Audubon's studio and rehearsal space.

User Research

In my preliminary research I interviewed a set of users that met my user persona criteria and had never booked a session with Audubon before, and asked them questions aboout their usual booking expereince. I also conducted competitor research to analyze how other companies handled online bookings.

Wireframing & Prototyping

I usually start my wireframing process with a couple of paper sketches to build out my ideas for the user's journey. Once I have a page flow, I start designing the page layout, the information architechture, and interactions for the booking process.

Usability Testing

I conducted usability tests with high fidelity prototypes and observed how each user interacted with them. Afterword, I gave them a usability survey to ask them more direct questions about their expereince with the booking process.

Outcome

UX CHALLENGES

I faced a number of challenges throughout this project, the biggest being that I had to conduct a lot of testing and draw insights upon those outcomes on my own. Personally, I enjoy working collaboratively with others and I also think having other designers and devs generating ideas for a user expereince is highly benifical because you have more perspectives in a room to solve a problem.

LESSONS LEARNED

Working alone thoughout this process also taught me a lot about how to effictively organize a user research study and use those insights to develop my designs. Developing goals with business stakeholders is an important part of defining the scope of the project, but conducting user research and usability testing are were the biggest sources of influence for how my ideas looked on a screen and what the user journey should look like.
